meanings.definition: An inscription placed at the end of a book or manuscript, typically with information about its production.
meanings.sent1: The colophons in ancient scrolls often revealed the scribes' names.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy reading the colophons in books to learn about the authors.
meanings.sent3: The colophons in the old manuscripts sometimes contained funny doodles.
meanings.sent4: Her signature at the end of the letter was like a colophons, marking its completion.
meanings.sent5: The colophons in the books were like tiny windows into the past.

meanings.sent1: The colophons on the spine of the book indicated the publishing house.
meanings.sent2: I recognized the colophons on the cover as belonging to my favorite publisher.
meanings.sent3: The colophons on the packaging were so cute, they made me smile.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a colophons, a trademark of his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The colophons on the products were like little stamps of quality.
